page.title: 02General Survey Page 2
page.content: The land surrounding the village is used for agriculture,forestry, game rearing and recreation and is crossed by a Roman Road.Now there is a network of narrow roads serving the village and scattered dwellings and farms. there is one ancient bridge over the River Allen built in the reign of George III. The River Allen is a meandering river which provides water for the mill and meadows for grazing.The river also supports a wealth of wildlife.The predominance of chalk in the terrain allows good drainage and a very alkaline soil. A large proportion of older houses are owned by Crichel Estates,the main land owner in the area. There are also two pockets of council houses and the rest are privately owned with only three new buildings erected in the last decade.
